question: How many models does each car maker produce? List maker full name, id and the number.

question: What is the full name of each car maker, along with its id and how many models it produces?
query: SELECT T1.FullName ,  T1.Id ,  count(*) FROM CAR_MAKERS AS T1 JOIN MODEL_LIST AS T2 ON T1.Id  =  T2.Maker GROUP BY T1.Id;
result_fields_description: FullName: Official name of the car manufacturer; Id: Unique identifier for the car maker; count(*): Total number of models produced by the car maker

question: Which model of the car has the minimum horsepower?
query: SELECT T1.Model FROM CAR_NAMES AS T1 JOIN CARS_DATA AS T2 ON T1.MakeId  =  T2.Id ORDER BY T2.horsepower ASC LIMIT 1;
result_fields_description: Model: Name of the car model with minimum horsepower

question: What is the model of the car with the smallest amount of horsepower?
query: SELECT T1.Model FROM CAR_NAMES AS T1 JOIN CARS_DATA AS T2 ON T1.MakeId  =  T2.Id ORDER BY T2.horsepower ASC LIMIT 1;
result_fields_description: Model: The model name of the car with the smallest horsepower.

question: Find the model of the car whose weight is below the average weight.
query: SELECT T1.model FROM CAR_NAMES AS T1 JOIN CARS_DATA AS T2 ON T1.MakeId  =  T2.Id WHERE T2.Weight  <  (SELECT avg(Weight) FROM CARS_DATA)
result_fields_description: model: The model name of the car.

question: What is the model for the car with a weight smaller than the average?
query: SELECT T1.model FROM CAR_NAMES AS T1 JOIN CARS_DATA AS T2 ON T1.MakeId  =  T2.Id WHERE T2.Weight  <  (SELECT avg(Weight) FROM CARS_DATA)
result_fields_description: model: Name of the car model with below-average weight.

question: Find the name of the makers that produced some cars in the year of 1970?
query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.Maker FROM CAR_MAKERS AS T1 JOIN MODEL_LIST AS T2 ON T1.Id  =  T2.Maker JOIN CAR_NAMES AS T3 ON T2.model  =  T3.model JOIN CARS_DATA AS T4 ON T3.MakeId  =  T4.id WHERE T4.year  =  '1970';
result_fields_description: Maker: Unique car manufacturer name that produced cars in 1970

question: What is the name of the different car makers who produced a car in 1970?
query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.Maker FROM CAR_MAKERS AS T1 JOIN MODEL_LIST AS T2 ON T1.Id  =  T2.Maker JOIN CAR_NAMES AS T3 ON T2.model  =  T3.model JOIN CARS_DATA AS T4 ON T3.MakeId  =  T4.id WHERE T4.year  =  '1970';
result_fields_description: Maker: Unique name of car manufacturer who made 1970 cars

question: Find the make and production time of the cars that were produced in the earliest year?
query: SELECT T2.Make ,  T1.Year FROM CARS_DATA AS T1 JOIN CAR_NAMES AS T2 ON T1.Id  =  T2.MakeId WHERE T1.Year  =  (SELECT min(YEAR) FROM CARS_DATA);
result_fields_description: Make: Manufacturer or brand name of the car; Year: Production year of the car model

question: What is the maker of the carr produced in the earliest year and what year was it?
query: SELECT T2.Make ,  T1.Year FROM CARS_DATA AS T1 JOIN CAR_NAMES AS T2 ON T1.Id  =  T2.MakeId WHERE T1.Year  =  (SELECT min(YEAR) FROM CARS_DATA);
result_fields_description: Make: Manufacturer or brand of the car; Year: Production year of the car (earliest in dataset)

question: Which distinct car models are the produced after 1980?

result_fields_description: model: Distinct car model name produced after 1980

question: How many car makers are there in each continents? List the continent name and the count.

question: Which are the car makers which produce at least 2 models and more than 3 car makers ? List the id and the maker .
query: select t1.id ,  t1.maker from car_makers as t1 join model_list as t2 on t1.id  =  t2.maker group by t1.id having count(*)  >=  2 intersect select t1.id ,  t1.maker from car_makers as t1 join model_list as t2 on t1.id  =  t2.maker join car_names as t3 on t2.model  =  t3.model group by t1.id having count(*)  >  3;
result_fields_description: id: Unique identifier for the car maker; maker: Name of the car manufacturer

question: What are the ids and makers of all car makers that produce at least 2 models and make more than 3 cars?
query: SELECT T1.Id ,  T1.Maker FROM CAR_MAKERS AS T1 JOIN MODEL_LIST AS T2 ON T1.Id  =  T2.Maker GROUP BY T1.Id HAVING count(*)  >=  2 INTERSECT SELECT T1.Id ,  T1.Maker FROM CAR_MAKERS AS T1 JOIN MODEL_LIST AS T2 ON T1.Id  =  T2.Maker JOIN CAR_NAMES AS T3 ON T2.model  =  T3.model GROUP BY T1.Id HAVING count(*)  >  3;
result_fields_description: Id: Unique identifier for the car maker.; Maker: Name of the car manufacturer.

question: What are the id and names of the countries which have more than 3 car makers or produce the 'fiat' model?
query: SELECT T1.countryId ,  T1.CountryName FROM Countries AS T1 JOIN CAR_MAKERS AS T2 ON T1.CountryId  =  T2.Country GROUP BY T1.countryId HAVING count(*)  >  3 UNION SELECT T1.countryId ,  T1.CountryName FROM Countries AS T1 JOIN CAR_MAKERS AS T2 ON T1.CountryId  =  T2.Country JOIN MODEL_LIST AS T3 ON T2.Id  =  T3.Maker WHERE T3.Model  =  'fiat';

question: Show names of teachers and the courses they are arranged to teach.
query: SELECT T3.Name ,  T2.Course FROM course_arrange AS T1 JOIN course AS T2 ON T1.Course_ID  =  T2.Course_ID JOIN teacher AS T3 ON T1.Teacher_ID  =  T3.Teacher_ID
result_fields_description: Name: Teacher's name from the teacher table; Course: Course name from the course table

question: What is the name of each teacher and what course they teach?

result_fields_description: Name: Name of the teacher; Course: Name of the course taught by the teacher

question: Show names of teachers and the courses they are arranged to teach in ascending alphabetical order of the teacher's name.

result_fields_description: Name: Teacher's name in ascending alphabetical order; Course: Course name the teacher is arranged to teach

question: What are the names of the teachers and the courses they teach in ascending alphabetical order by the name of the teacher?

result_fields_description: Name: Name of the teacher; Course: Name of the course taught by the teacher

question: Show the name of the teacher for the math course.

result_fields_description: Name: Name of the teacher teaching the math course

question: What are the names of the people who teach math courses?

result_fields_description: Name: Name of the teacher who teaches math courses

question: Show names of teachers and the number of courses they teach.

result_fields_description: Name: Teacher's name; COUNT(*): Number of courses taught by the teacher

question: Show names of teachers that teach at least two courses.

result_fields_description: Name: Name of the teacher teaching at least two courses.

result_fields_description: Name: Name of the teacher teaching at least two courses

question: Find the id and name of the museum that has the most staff members?

question: find the id, name and age for visitors who visited some museums more than once.
query: SELECT t1.id ,  t1.name ,  t1.age FROM visitor AS t1 JOIN visit AS t2 ON t1.id  =  t2.visitor_id GROUP BY t1.id HAVING count(*)  >  1
result_fields_description: id: Unique identifier for the visitor; name: Name of the visitor; age: Age of the visitor

question: What are the id, name and membership level of visitors who have spent the largest amount of money in total in all museum tickets?
query: SELECT t2.visitor_id ,  t1.name ,  t1.Level_of_membership FROM visitor AS t1 JOIN visit AS t2 ON t1.id  =  t2.visitor_id GROUP BY t2.visitor_id ORDER BY sum(t2.Total_spent) DESC LIMIT 1
result_fields_description: visitor_id: Unique identifier for the visitor; name: Full name of the visitor; Level_of_membership: Membership tier or level of the visitor

question: What are the id and name of the museum visited most times?

result_fields_description: Museum_ID: Unique identifier of the museum; name: Name of the museum visited most frequently

question: What is the name of the visitor who visited both a museum opened before 2009 and a museum opened after 2011?

question: What are the death and injury situations caused by the ship with tonnage 't'?
query: SELECT T1.killed ,  T1.injured FROM death AS T1 JOIN ship AS t2 ON T1.caused_by_ship_id  =  T2.id WHERE T2.tonnage  =  't'
result_fields_description: killed: Number of people killed by the ship; injured: Number of people injured by the ship

question: What are the name and results of the battles when the bulgarian commander is not 'Boril'
query: SELECT name ,  RESULT FROM battle WHERE bulgarian_commander != 'Boril'
result_fields_description: name: Name of the battle; RESULT: Outcome or result of the battle

question: What are the different ids and names of the battles that lost any 'Brig' type shipes?
query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.id ,  T1.name FROM battle AS T1 JOIN ship AS T2 ON T1.id  =  T2.lost_in_battle WHERE T2.ship_type  =  'Brig'
result_fields_description: id: Unique identifier for the battle; name: Name of the battle where Brig ships were lost

question: What are the ids and names of the battles that led to more than 10 people killed in total.
query: SELECT T1.id ,  T1.name FROM battle AS T1 JOIN ship AS T2 ON T1.id  =  T2.lost_in_battle JOIN death AS T3 ON T2.id  =  T3.caused_by_ship_id GROUP BY T1.id HAVING sum(T3.killed)  >  10
result_fields_description: id: Unique identifier for the battle; name: Name of the battle

question: What is the ship id and name that caused most total injuries?
query: SELECT T2.id ,  T2.name FROM death AS T1 JOIN ship AS t2 ON T1.caused_by_ship_id  =  T2.id GROUP BY T2.id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1
result_fields_description: id: Unique identifier of the ship; name: Name of the ship

question: What are the distinct battle names which are between bulgarian commander 'Kaloyan' and latin commander 'Baldwin I'?
query: SELECT name FROM battle WHERE bulgarian_commander  =  'Kaloyan' AND latin_commander  =  'Baldwin I'
result_fields_description: name: Name of the battle between Kaloyan and Baldwin I

question: How many different results are there for the battles?
query: SELECT count(DISTINCT RESULT) FROM battle
result_fields_description: count(DISTINCT RESULT): Number of unique battle outcome types

question: How many battles did not lose any ship with tonnage '225'?
query: SELECT count(*) FROM battle WHERE id NOT IN ( SELECT lost_in_battle FROM ship WHERE tonnage  =  '225' );
result_fields_description: count(*): Count of battles where no ship of tonnage 225 was lost

question: List the name and date the battle that has lost the ship named 'Lettice' and the ship named 'HMS Atalanta'
query: SELECT T1.name ,  T1.date FROM battle AS T1 JOIN ship AS T2 ON T1.id  =  T2.lost_in_battle WHERE T2.name  =  'Lettice' INTERSECT SELECT T1.name ,  T1.date FROM battle AS T1 JOIN ship AS T2 ON T1.id  =  T2.lost_in_battle WHERE T2.name  =  'HMS Atalanta'
result_fields_description: name: Name of the battle where both ships were lost; date: Date when the battle occurred

question: Show names, results and bulgarian commanders of the battles with no ships lost in the 'English Channel'.
query: SELECT name ,  RESULT ,  bulgarian_commander FROM battle EXCEPT SELECT T1.name ,  T1.result ,  T1.bulgarian_commander FROM battle AS T1 JOIN ship AS T2 ON T1.id  =  T2.lost_in_battle WHERE T2.location  =  'English Channel'
result_fields_description: name: Name of the naval battle; result: Outcome or result of the battle; bulgarian_commander: Name of the Bulgarian commander in the battle

question: Which department offers the most number of degrees? List department name and id.
query: SELECT T2.department_name ,  T1.department_id FROM Degree_Programs AS T1 JOIN Departments AS T2 ON T1.department_id  =  T2.department_id GROUP BY T1.department_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1
result_fields_description: department_name: Name of the academic department offering degrees; department_id: Unique identifier for the department with most degrees

question: What is the name and id of the department with the most number of degrees ?

result_fields_description: department_name: Name of the department with most degrees; department_id: Unique identifier of the department with most degrees

result_fields_description: first_name: Student's first name from students table

question: Of all the contestants who got voted, what is the contestant number and name of the contestant who got least votes?

result_fields_description: contestant_number: Unique identifier for the contestant.; contestant_name: Name of the contestant.

question: What are the number of votes from state 'NY' or 'CA'?

question: How many contestants did not get voted?
query: SELECT count(*) FROM contestants WHERE contestant_number NOT IN ( SELECT contestant_number FROM votes )

question: What is the area code in which the most voters voted?

result_fields_description: area_code: Telephone area code where voters are located

question: What are the create dates, states, and phone numbers of the votes that were for the contestant named 'Tabatha Gehling'?
query: SELECT T2.created ,  T2.state ,  T2.phone_number FROM contestants AS T1 JOIN votes AS T2 ON T1.contestant_number  =  T2.contestant_number WHERE T1.contestant_name  =  'Tabatha Gehling'
result_fields_description: created: Date and time when the vote was cast; state: State where the vote originated from; phone_number: Phone number used to cast the vote

question: List the area codes in which voters voted both for the contestant 'Tabatha Gehling' and the contestant 'Kelly Clauss'.
query: SELECT T3.area_code FROM contestants AS T1 JOIN votes AS T2 ON T1.contestant_number  =  T2.contestant_number JOIN area_code_state AS T3 ON T2.state  =  T3.state WHERE T1.contestant_name  =  'Tabatha Gehling' INTERSECT SELECT T3.area_code FROM contestants AS T1 JOIN votes AS T2 ON T1.contestant_number  =  T2.contestant_number JOIN area_code_state AS T3 ON T2.state  =  T3.state WHERE T1.contestant_name  =  'Kelly Clauss'
result_fields_description: area_code: Telephone area code where voters cast ballots

result_fields_description: Code: Unique country code identifier.; Name: Official name of the country.; Continent: Continent where the country is located.; Region: Geographic region of the country.; SurfaceArea: Total land and water area in square kilometers.; IndepYear: Year the country gained independence.; Population: Total population of the country.; LifeExpectancy: Average life expectancy at birth.; GNP: Gross National Product.; GNPOld: Previous GNP value.; LocalName: Name of the country in its local language.; GovernmentForm: Type of government system.; HeadOfState: Name of the country's head of state.; Capital: Capital city's identifier code.; Code2: Two-letter country code.; CountryCode: Code linking to the country table.; Language: Name of the language spoken.; IsOfficial: Indicates if the language is official (T/F).; Percentage: Percentage of population speaking the language.
